issue.title: mytotalconnectcomfort.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://mytotalconnectcomfort.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmytotalconnectcomfort.com) ### Comment > This is the site I use to control my thermostat in my home so I need it to be working. I've been through extensive troubleshooting to fix this over the past few weeks and I had to take my computer to a specialist for $80 to determine that the issue is caused by AdGuard. I didn't think it was initially because I disabled AdGuard on this site and it still wouldn't load. However, he pointed out that if I completely exit AdGuard, then the site will load properly. My screenshots are of AdGuard still running on my computer, but with it disabled on the site, and the site will not load with "ERROR_CONNECTION_CLOSED". The second screenshot is after completely exiting AdGuard and not allowing it to run in the background and the site works normally. ``` Username: @JackLGM ``` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/5utfr3dywvocowow4g4gckw4ogoswkodlb2yh749tc.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/oyua20ko00g8o8880oko8sc4koc0wo0izgbu4ci99c.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for Windows v7.22.3 (5240) System version: | `Microsoft Windows NT 10.0.26200.0` Browser: | Edge License type: | paid AdGuard driver: | WFP Tracking protection: | **General settings**:
Block trackers,
Strip URLs from tracking parameters,
Hide your search queries,
Send Do-Not-Track header

**Tracking methods**:
Self-destructing third-party cookies (180)

**Browser API**:
Block WebRTC,
Block Push API,
Block Location API

**Windows tracking**:
Disable Windows Telemetry,
Turn off Advertising ID

**Miscellaneous**:
Remove X-Client-Data header from HTTP requests,
Protect against DPI DNS filtering: | server: `System`
filters: `User rules (url: none)` Filters: | Ad blocking:
AdGuard Base,
AdGuard Mobile Ads,
EasyList

Privacy:
AdGuard Tracking Protection,
AdGuard URL Tracking,
Peter Lowe's Blocklist,
Fanboy's Anti-Facebook List

Social widgets:
AdGuard Social Media,
Fanboy's Social Blocking List

Annoyances:
AdGuard Cookie Notices,
AdGuard Popups,
AdGuard Mobile App Banners,
AdGuard Other Annoyances,
AdGuard Widgets,
Fanboy's Annoyances,
Adblock Warning Removal List

Security:
Online Malicious URL Blocklist,
Phishing URL Blocklist,
Scam Blocklist by DurableNapkin,
uBlock Origin – Badware risks

Language-specific:
IndianList Custom filters: | `User rules (url: none)` Browsing Security: | enabled Browsing Security statistics: | disabled Userscripts: | disabled Userstyles: | disabled ### Issue configuration [Import](https://reports.adguard.com/settings/import.html?product_type=win&product_version=7.22.3+%285240%29&system_version=Microsoft+Windows+NT+10.0.26200.0&browser=edge&filters=2.3.4.11.17.18.19.20.21.22.101.122.123.204.207.208.225.253.255.256.257&custom_filters=User%2520rules%2520%28url%253A%2520none%29&dns_servers=System&dns.filters=User%2520rules%2520%28url%253A%2520none%29&dns.filters_enabled=true&dns.enabled=true&browsing_security.enabled=true&browsing_security.statistics_enabled=false&stealth.enabled=true&stealth.webrtc=true&stealth.push=true&stealth.location=true&stealth.flash=false&stealth.java=false&stealth.strip_url=true&stealth.hide_search_queries=true&stealth.DNT=true&stealth.x_client=true&stealth.dpi=true&stealth.third_party_cookies=180&stealth.disable_third_party_cache=false&stealth.block_third_party_auth=false&stealth.block_trackers=true&stealth.disable_wap_push_message_routing_service=false&stealth.disable_windows_defender=false&stealth.disable_windows_telemetry=true&stealth.turn_off_advertising_id=true&referrer=&win.wfp=true&license_type=paid&scheme_version=2&adblocking.enabled=true&dns.timeout=0&dns.fallback_mode=System&stealth.disable_windows_recall=true)

comment.body: When you see the issue again, instead of turning off the whole `Tracking Protection`, try with turning off each option inside it instead until you don't see the issue like previously.
